7fc45b19-9705-5562-9f62-823bd8a0022d.title: Acceptance Criteria - Prior to commencing excavation in any area and during excavation work, the Superintendent and the Contractor shall inspect each type of material encountered and subject to verification by appropriate laboratory testing, agree on the category of the material in accordance with clause 204.04.

ed83328b-5164-55f4-b7ed-cae184b450e1.title: If parameters are not met, remove 400mm of material mm below Cut Floor Level and replace with conforming Type B material.

1bf50ee7-765b-57a3-8a4c-c477f30f83c4.title: If removal and replacement of material below the Cut Floor Level is not required, surface shall be loosened to a depth of 150mm and re-compacted to meet the specified requirements.

0b0740a7-aa6d-51fa-a810-b3b368cecad2.title: Acceptance Criteria - Prior to the import of Type B material, FH to provide the Superintendent, at least 1 week prior to the commencement of cartage, copies of test results to confirm that the proposed Type B material complies with section 204 of the VicRoads Spec.

7a64425b-3765-563c-b414-0abedc357789.title: The boxing width shall not be less than specified or shown on the drawings and the edges of boxing shall not deviate by more than 50 mm from the designed offset from the centreline or design line.

06a76d39-da12-596e-a267-d96df35a6d9f.title: Inspection / Test Method - Site Inspection/ Document Review

33cfb61f-65e9-5254-a859-6dbb17da12ec.title: Acceptance Criteria - Where groundwater or seepage is encountered the Contractor shall notify the Superintendent and submit the proposed action to be taken to the Superintendent for review.

4b4f6e16-72f5-5ed9-aaf5-fc63b9eb74e8.title: The Contractor shall submit any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for the treatment and disposal of this groundwater.

67fa2a4c-1b3e-5b31-94c1-950c2294f897.title: Acceptance Criteria - Prior to construction of the regulating layer, the areas of rock subgrade shall be presented to the Superintendent for acceptance.

61d2ab17-7a99-54ab-b741-a56c24429148.title: Any necessary amendments to the subsurface drainage design including transverse subsurface drainage at the interfaces shall be presented to Superintendent for review.

62ec8e3c-3f87-5f5a-8d85-b738ce0a293c.title: Where unsuitable material is encountered the Contractor shall propose in situ treatment and depth of excavation to the Superintendent for review.

275b3c4e-f61a-5216-a01c-28655d0ac06a.title: Acceptance Criteria - Areas upon which fills are to be constructed, all layers of fill, and material within 150 mm of the cut floor level in cuts, shall be test rolled in accordance with Section 173. Superintendent to be present during all test rolling.

5bb63e0b-2219-5ae1-9dd5-2589af908fa0.title: Fulton Hogan to provide not less than 24hrs notice to the Superintendent of the location and commencement time for test rolling. Superintendent to be present during all test rolling.

d8d431e9-422c-5774-835f-e6ba941b3df1.title: Acceptance Criteria - Fill material shall be spread and compacted in layers not exceeding 200mm compacted thickness.

d508691b-9c30-5313-a3b1-791be35a18b8.title: Each layer shall be keyed in to the layer above by means of a textured surface

8f7f527a-a9fb-5a35-b617-724538920779.title: Any rocky material present must be uniform throughout the layer.

74460da4-d056-5982-bdb1-ad55dd248def.title: Frequency - Prior to construction of subgrade layer

0d6b9d20-c9e0-52f5-84c5-9d10851f7de6.title: Acceptance Criteria - The top of the Type B material, Cut Floor Level and subgrade surfaces shall be prepared to level and shape within the tolerances specified in Clause 204.03(g) to produce a smooth, hard, tightly bound surface, free from depressions capable of holding water)
